Text.Value: Whoever your enemies are, they have good reason to fear you.
Good luck, Yurgir. You're a fine warrior.
At least in the Blood War we know our adversaries.
Soldiers like us aren't made for complications, Karlach. Better to be pointed at prey, and to kill without question.
Been there, done that. Never again.
You fought well - we could use such strength in the Blood War.
I can respect that.
Until then, good luck to you, little rabbit. You're a finer hunter than any wolf.
And I'll gladly lend you my skills against them when the time comes.
It was an honour to fight alongside you, Karlach.
Understandable. You have your own battles to fight.
I'll have slain a score of demons before you have your next hot meal.
Until then, keep your flame bright, and make ash of those who oppose you.
I think you've earned a break.
Hunting shadows in a temple for a hundred years was a break.
And you are a worthy ally.
I'd rather die a thousand deaths. But I miss the simplicity of bashing skulls, I suppose.
But down here in the hells, Karlach, I think you would burn bright forever.
I'd rather spend what time I have left saving my own world.
Ever tempted to rejoin the ranks, soldier?
It is dishonourable to slay an ally. But I'm not surprised - mortals have no honour.
Now I'm free of Raphael's blasted contract, I can return to the frontlines.
You're not going anywhere - I'm cleansing this place of every devil, you included.
You did us a favour, Yurgir, so I'm going to let that slide.

EditorData.NodeContext: Not super mad, but triggered by Yurgir's suggestion that she'd be a good flighter in the blood war

Text.Value: I have my own frontline to return to, in Baldur's Gate.

Synopsis:
Dialogue after combat with Raphael. 
Happens only when Yurgir is an ally.
